author: Prakash Kamat
text:
The Opposition in the Goa Assembly on Tuesday grilled Tourism Minister Dilip Parulekar for spending over Rs. 19 crore on junkets outside the State over the last three years in the name of tourism promotion.

“In three years, the expenditure was Rs. 19 crore and in this year’s statement, the bills have not been submitted. The amount spent must be more than Rs. 19 crore,” former Chief Minister Digambar Kamat told the Assembly, quoting statistics from Mr. Parulekar’s reply.

Questioning the logic behind conducting official visits to Los Angeles, New York, Japan, Washington, Australia, New Zealand, and Nepal, Mr. Kamat asked Mr. Parulekar how many tourists from these countries had visited Goa. The Minister could not provide the answer.

Mr. Kamat also pointed out that even officials from the Water Resources Ministry had joined tourism officials on foreign tours.

Defending the junkets, Mr. Parulekar said the previous Congress-led coalition government headed by Mr. Kamat too had sanctioned foreign tours of the Tourism Ministry.
title: Opposition grills Goa Tourism Minister over foreign junkets
